intro: Oedera longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed oedera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warm climates.
